clinical_study.brief_title: Exercise for Rectal Cancer Patients Undergoing Preoperative Neoadjuvant Chemoradiation
clinical_study.official_title: Safety and Feasibility of an Exercise Intervention for Adults Undergoing Preoperative Neoadjuvant Chemoradiation for Rectal Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: Currently, there is no clear indication if exercise is safe and if it confers health benefits for adults undergoing preoperative neoadjuvant chemoradiation for rectal cancer - a population who may have limited exercise tolerance and who may be at an increased risk for adverse events associated with exercise. In this prospective single-arm feasibility trial, we aim to examine the safety and feasibility of a 12-week exercise intervention for adults undergoing preoperative neoadjuvant chemoradiation for rectal cancer to inform the development of a large-scale randomized controlled trial that will assess the efficacy of exercise administered during preoperative neoadjuvant chemoradiation for rectal cancer. Adults diagnosed with rectal cancer and scheduled for preoperative neoadjuvant chemoradiation will be recruited over a 12-month period into a supervised exercise intervention consisting of aerobic and strength training to be done 3 times per week. Feasibility, safety, patient-reported outcomes, and physical tests will be performed pre-intervention and post-intervention. This study will provide data on the feasibility of an exercise intervention and will help determine if it is safe to progress with a large-scale randomized controlled trial to test the benefits of exercise for adults undergoing preoperative neoadjuvant chemoradiation for rectal cancer. It will also provide initial estimates of the parameters for patient-reported outcomes, which are required to calculate the sample size for the large-scale randomized controlled trial to ensure it is sufficiently powered.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 12 weeks
primary_outcome.description: The number of eligible participants who enrol in the study out of the number who are referred.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 12 weeks
primary_outcome.description: The number of participants completing the intervention and all scheduled assessments.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 12 weeks
primary_outcome.description: The number of exercise sessions completed out of 36.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with Adverse Events
primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 12 weeks
primary_outcome.description: The number of participants reporting or presenting adverse events (e.g., injury) that occurs as a result of participating in the exercise sessions and/or its assessments.

other_outcome.measure: Quality of Life: Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy - Colorectal (Ward et al., 1999; Yost et al., 2005)
other_outcome.description: Change in self-reported quality of life from baseline to post-intervention.

other_outcome.measure: Cognitive Functioning: Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy - Cognitive Function (Wagner et al., 2004)
other_outcome.description: Change in self-reported cognitive function from baseline to post-intervention.

other_outcome.measure: Symptoms of Fatigue: the Functional Assessment of Chronic Illness Therapy - Fatigue Scale (Yellen et al., 1997)
other_outcome.description: Change in self-reported fatigue from baseline to post-intervention.

other_outcome.measure: Affect: Positive and Negative Affect Schedule (Watson et al., 1988)
other_outcome.description: Change in self-reported affect from baseline to post-intervention.

other_outcome.measure: Physical Activity Behaviour: Leisure Time Exercise Questionnaire (Godin & Shephard, 1985)
other_outcome.description: Change in self-reported physical activity (over the past 7 days) from baseline to post-intervention.

other_outcome.measure: Resting Heart Rate: Heart Rate Monitor (Polar A300)
other_outcome.description: Change in resting heart rate from baseline to post-intervention.

other_outcome.measure: Blood Pressure: Blood Pressure Monitor (HealthSmart Digital Blood Pressure Monitor)
other_outcome.description: Change in resting blood pressure from baseline to post-intervention.

other_outcome.measure: Body Mass Index: Tanita Scale (TBF-310 GS)
other_outcome.description: Change in body mass index from baseline to post-intervention.

other_outcome.measure: Aerobic Capacity: 6-Minute Walk Test (Canadian Society for Exercise Physiology, 2013; Irwin, 2012)
other_outcome.description: Change in aerobic capacity (i.e., total distance walked in 6 minutes) from baseline to post-intervention.

other_outcome.measure: Musculoskeletal Strength: Combined Grip Strength Using a Handheld Dynamometer (Canadian Society for Exercise Physiology, 2013, 2013; Irwin, 2012)
other_outcome.description: Change in musculoskeletal strength (i.e., force exerted in kilograms on the handheld dynamometer) from baseline to post-intervention.
The socio-demographic and medical information collected will be used to describe the sample.

arm_group.description: Participants will be asked to complete a 12-week exercise intervention and all study assessments.

intervention.description: Participants will engage in supervised exercise 3 times per week for 60-75 minutes/session for 12 weeks. Sessions will include a warm-up (aerobic activity less than < 60% of heart rate reserve), aerobic training (30 minutes of exercise at 60-75% of heart rate reserve, using cycle ergometers/treadmills), strength training (8 exercises; upper body, lower body, and core), and a cool-down (aerobic activity less than < 60% of heart rate reserve) component.
